Class UserController

java.lang.Object
juancarlos.tfg.teleprompter.controllers.UserController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/users") public class UserController extends Object
Controller class that handles user-related operations including user management, account activation, password reset, and user profile updates.
Author:
Juan Carlos

  • Method Details

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("/create") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> createUser(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestBody User user)
      Creates a new user in the system. Only accessible by administrators.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      user - The user object containing user details
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing success or error message

    • activateAccount

      @PostMapping("/activate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> activateAccount(@RequestBody User request)
      Activates a user account using the verification token.
      Parameters:
      request - The user object containing the verification token
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing activation status message

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<User> getUser(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @PathVariable("id") Long id)
      Retrieves a user by their ID. Only accessible by administrators.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      id - The ID of the user to retrieve
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the user object or null if not found

    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<User>> getAllUsers(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Retrieves all users in the system. Only accessible by administrators.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing a list of all users

    • requestPasswordReset

      @PostMapping("/request-password-reset") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> requestPasswordReset(@RequestBody User request)
      Initiates the password reset process by sending a reset email.
      Parameters:
      request - The user object containing username or email
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the status of the password reset request

    • resetPassword

      @PostMapping("/reset-password") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> resetPassword(@RequestBody User request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Resets a user's password using a reset token or current session.
      Parameters:
      request - The user object containing reset token and new password
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the status of the password reset

    • deleteUser

      @PostMapping("/delete/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> deleteUser(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody(required=false) User request)
      Deletes a user from the system. Can be performed by administrators or the user themselves.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      id - The ID of the user to delete
      request - The user object containing password for self-deletion
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the status of the deletion operation

    • updateUser

      @PatchMapping("/update") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> updateUser(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @RequestBody User user)
      Updates the current user's profile information.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      user - The user object containing updated information
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the status of the update operation

    • updateUserById

      @PatchMapping("/update/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> updateUserById(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session, @PathVariable("id") Long id, @RequestBody User user)
      Updates a user's profile information by ID. Only accessible by administrators.
      Parameters:
      session - The HTTP session to verify user authentication
      id - The ID of the user to update
      user - The user object containing updated information
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity containing the status of the update operation
